snippet: Nicolas Sarkozy, the former French president, has sparked a furor by criticizing his successor's alleged inaction on Syria. Right or wrong, should retired leaders involve themselves in day-to-day issues or retire gracefully?
abstract: Nicolas Sarkozy, the former French president, has sparked a furor by criticizing his successor's alleged inaction on Syria. Right or wrong, should retired leaders involve themselves in day-to-day issues or retire gracefully?

headline.main: French Fury as Sarkozy Intervenes on Syria
